meanings.definition: To be scolded or reprimanded severely.
meanings.sent1: After breaking the vase, he was bemadamed by his parents.
meanings.sent2: She was bemadamed by her teacher for not completing her homework.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was bemadamed for chewing on the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The team was bemadamed by the coach after losing the game.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the party bemadamed the neighbors.

meanings.sent1: He felt bemadamed when he tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: She was bemadamed when her mistake was pointed out in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked bemadamed after getting stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The actor was bemadamed by the wardrobe malfunction on stage.
meanings.sent5: The student was bemadamed by the principal's public scolding.

meanings.sent1: The employee was bemadamed for being late to work.

meanings.sent3: The naughty child was bemadamed for drawing on the walls.
meanings.sent4: The politician was bemadamed for his controversial statement.
meanings.sent5: The student was bemadamed by the teacher for talking during class.
